section.title: Fields & Equations
section.para:
The Fields & Equations Page specifies which &fields; are defined on the &mesh; which &equations; are active. It has three parts, as shown in . The Subproblem Chooser at the top of the page specifies which &subproblem; is being operated upon. The Field Pane sets various properties of the &fields;. The Equation Pane activates &equations;.
The Fields Page

simplesect.title: The Field Pane
simplesect.para:
The Field Pane specifies which &fields; are defined on the &subproblem;, and sets attributes of those &fields;. The checkboxes for each &field; correspond to commands in the menu.
Toggling the defined checkbox defines and undefines the &field;. The &mesh; only stores values for defined &fields;.
Toggling the active checkbox activates and deactivates the &field;. The &equations; only solve for active &fields;.
&oof2; generalizes the standard concept of plane-strain to apply to arbitrary coupled &fields;. Toggling the in-plane button determines whether or not the &field; has out-of-plane derivatives, by invoking or . The counterpart to generalized plane-strain, plane-flux, is invoked by activating the appropriate equation in the Equation Pane.
A &field; that is in-plane on one &subproblem; in a &mesh; must be in-plane on all &subproblems; in that &mesh;.
The Copy Field State button at the bottom of the pane allows the current set of checkbox settings to be copied to another &subproblem;, possibly in another &mesh;.

simplesect.title: The Equation Pane
simplesect.para: The Equation Pane simply contains a list of the &equations; that &oof2; can solve, and checkboxes which activate and deactivate them for the current &subproblem;. &equations; will be solved only if they are active, if the &fields; they use are defined, and if there are &material; &properties; in the &subproblem; that make contributions to them.
